message.content: Since the common ratio of the geometric sequence is $\dfrac{\left(\dfrac{9}{2}\right)}{3} = \dfrac{3}{2}$, it follows that the $n$th term is equal to $$\dfrac{3}{2}^{n - 1}(3).$$ Therefore, the $8$th term is equal to $$\dfrac{3}{2}^{8 - 1}(3) = \left(\dfrac{3}{2}\right)^7(3) = \dfrac{2187}{128}(3) = \boxed{\dfrac{6561}{128}}.$$
